intro: Xanthophyllum rufum, commonly known as the red-leafed goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically reddish-brown, which gives it its common name, and it thrives in sunny, well-drained soils. Xanthophyllum rufum is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
